ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments:
Basically learned how to draw and bring my creative ideas to light. Learned how to draw with charcoal for the first time.

Made me appreciate art more.
I was able to learn not only how to approach drawing from a better technical angle, but also skills in time management, planning, and patience that are unique to this classroom environment.

I definitely got better at drawing because of this course! I felt I learned some techniques in perspective, value, portraiture, and other drawing techniques, and I definitely saw improvement as the semester progressed.
Consideration of the line and perspective in drawing
Visual thinking skills, design skills, visual communication skills.
charcoal drawing, line, value, perspective
I learned to see things and people in a new way, to create lines with my whole body, and to use new mediums such as charcoal.

I hadn't taken an art class since middle school, so I had a lot to catch up on! We learned about drawing with line and drawing with value; learned about how to draw portraiture and draw with one- and two-point perspective; learned how to use vine charcoal, compressed charcoal, and different kinds of pencils. I realized that I really enjoy working with charcoal, and that if I put the time into a drawing, I can make something I feel really proud of. That's a pretty general theme here - I often go into a new subject area thinking "I probably can't really do this; this is probably for the kids who have been doing it for much longer," but then I try it out and realize "this is really accessible and everyone should try it!"

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments:
Strengths: very laid back atmosphere, not very stressful at all, very welcoming environment of all skills
Kern and the TA, John, were super helpful and chill

Weaknesses: not rigorous if you are a big art person

Strength: Flexible learning environment improved my ability to pay attention and show interest in the course
Weaknesses: The length of the class was extremely long, I think perhaps if it was set up with a 10 minute break in the middle we could be more productive for the full length of the session.
An evaluation of peoples beginning art levels would be helpful
Strengths: Kern is basically buddha, everyone in the class was sweet, feedback in class was honest, drawing advice was helpful
I wish there was more in-class instruction on pencil drawing.

Kern and Can were great instructors - super calm and friendly, really good vibes. That's a huge strength of the course. Another strength was the way it was set up - twice a week, two long stretches to just draw or work on whatever we were working on that week. I really liked the student artist presentations, getting to see and learn about different famous artists each week. The short example / instruction / mini lectures combined with a long time to work on the new technique was great. No weaknesses!

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments:
yes, even if you are not art major related

always good to expand your mind

I would highly recommend this course to other students (I already have). It's a great opportunity to develop skills outside of what you see in the typical traditional learning environment, and I still find these skills extremely valuable in their wide range of applications.

Yes, I would recommend this course to another student! Kern is wonderful, the workload is very light, and this class is a wonderful break from some of the crazy workload classes at Yale. If you're interested in drawing at all, you will enjoy this class!
Yes! It's that simple.
Yes. You can't learn to draw without doing it, and I think this class gives you the tools to learn at the same time as just putting you in a space where you are forced to try.
Yes i would recommend it to anyone.

10/10 would recommend. Super fun, feels really good to draw, great teachers, likely an interesting group of other students, people you wouldn't necessarily see or meet otherwise. Homework is low, only five assignments, projects are open and fun.
